Returns: a @B_com#google#android#gms#location#GeofencingEvent_E@ object or null if the given intent is null
Parameters: the intent to extract the geofencing event data from
fromIntent(android.content.Intent).Description: Creates a @B_com#google#android#gms#location#GeofencingEvent_E@ object from the given intent.

Returns: the error code specified in @B_com#google#android#gms#location#GeofenceStatusCodes_E@ or -1 if @B_com#google#android#gms#location#GeofencingEvent#hasError_E@ returns false.
getErrorCode().Description: Returns the error code that explains the error that triggered the intent specified in @B_com#google#android#gms#location#GeofencingEvent#fromIntent_E@.

Returns: -1 if the intent specified in @B_com#google#android#gms#location#GeofencingEvent#fromIntent_E@ is not generated for a transition alert; Otherwise returns the GEOFENCE_TRANSITION_ flags value defined in @B_com#google#android#gms#location#Geofence_E@.
getGeofenceTransition().Description: Returns the transition type of the geofence transition alert.

Returns: true if an error triggered the intent specified in @B_com#google#android#gms#location#GeofencingEvent#fromIntent_E@, otherwise false
hasError().Description: Whether an error triggered this intent.

Returns: the location that triggered this geofence alert or null if it's not included in the intent specified in @B_com#google#android#gms#location#GeofencingEvent#fromIntent_E@
getTriggeringLocation().Description: Gets the location that triggered the geofence transition. Triggering location is only available if the calling app links against Google Play services 5.0 SDK.

Returns: a list of geofences that triggered this geofence transition alert or null if the intent specified in @B_com#google#android#gms#location#GeofencingEvent#fromIntent_E@ is not generated for a geofence transition alert
getTriggeringGeofences().Description: Returns a list of geofences that triggered this geofence transition alert.

ClassDesc: Represents an event from the @B_com#google#android#gms#location#GeofencingApi_E@ API. The event can be A geofence triggering event generated when a geofence transition happens. An error happens after geofences are registered and being monitored.
